article.name: How usage fees are calculated
article.title: How usage fees are calculated
article.body:
*This English translation is for reference purposes only ( original text).

Starting with usage in November 2024, the numbers of hosts and metrics will each be calculated as a basis for billing (see here for details on how usage fees through October 2024 will be calculated).

*A different calculation method may be utilized if you use the service through a special contract or Mackerel partner.

  • Minimum usage fees
    • If you use billable Mackerel features such as posting metrics or external URL monitors, and your usage fees are less than the fee for 1 standard host, your charges will be rounded up to 1,982 JPY (tax excluded; 2,180 JPY tax included), the fee for 1 standard host
      • If you do not use billable features in that month, no charges will be incurred
  • Metrics
    • These are the basis for calculation. A metric contains multiple data points
    • 1 metric denotes 60 × 24 × number of days in that month data points
    • There is a cost of 10 JPY (tax excluded) per metric
    • Examples of posting to data points and numbers of metrics are given below.
      • If there is posting at 1-minute granularity for 1 month from the beginning to the end of the month, it is 1 metric
      • If there is posting at 1-minute granularity for half a month, it is 0.5 metrics. The total, rounded up number is the number of billable metrics
  • Host metrics
    • The cost of 1 standard host includes 200 metrics associated with that host
    • The cost of 1 micro host includes 30 metrics associated with that host
    • There is a cost of 1,982 JPY (tax excluded; 2,180 JPY tax included) per standard host and ¥600 (tax excluded; 660 JPY tax included) per micro host
    • For both standard hosts and micro hosts, metric costs will be incurred for metrics that exceed the limit
    • The number of host metrics for a host is determined by the following formula:
      • Number of system metrics + number of custom metrics + number of check monitors
  • Service metrics and labeled metrics
    • Service metrics are treated as metrics not associated with a host, and incur costs
    • Labeled metrics are also treated as metrics not associated with a host, and incur costs
  • External URL monitors
    • Converted to standard hosts by the following formula:
      • Rounded up value of (number of external URL monitors used - 20) ÷ 20
      • Value is 0 (no standard host conversion) if number of external URL monitors used is less than 20
    • If associated with a service, service metric costs are incurred separately
  • Anomaly detection for roles
    • Every 5 hosts included in a role subject to anomaly detection for roles are counted as 1 standard host. The calculation is as follows:
      • Rounded up value of number of hosts subject to anomaly detection ÷ 5
    • If the same host belongs to multiple roles subject to anomaly detection for roles, it is counted separately in each as a host subject to anomaly detection for roles
    • Calculations are conducted based on the number of hosts computed according to a monthly average
  • Traces
    • You will be charged for the number of spans posted during the month, from the beginning of the month to the end of the month
    • The first 5M spans each month are free of charge. (1M represents 1 million)
    • For any amount exceeding the 5M span, a fee of 300 JPY (tax excluded; 330 JPY tax included) will be incurred per 1M span.
      • The smallest unit is 1M span. If it is less than 1M span, it will be rounded up.
    • The number of spans subject to billing is determined by the following calculation
      • (Number of spans posted - 5M) ÷ 1M

Monitoring rule items and custom dashboards are not billable, but please note the following limitations.

  • They cannot be created in excess of your plan's upper limit
  • If you would like to create monitoring rules above the upper limit, please apply for a loosening of the upper limit here

Examples under the Standard plan

The number of metrics associated with a host under the Standard plan is 200 for a standard host and 30 for a micro host.

Examples based on usage patterns are given below (all amounts exclude taxes).

Case 1

Case 1 Metrics used /
Number of external URL monitors		 Excess metrics handled /
Number of external URL monitors		 Billed standard hosts Billed micro hosts Billed metrics
Standard host A metrics 150 0 1 - 0
Standard host B metrics 250 50 1 - 50
Micro host A metrics 20 0 - 1 0
Micro host B metrics 50 20 - 1 20
Service metrics 10 - - - 10
External URL monitors 10 0 0 - -

You are using 2 standard hosts, 2 micro hosts, 10 service metrics, and 10 external URL monitors. Standard host B has an excess of 50 metrics, and micro host B has an excess of 20 metrics. The charges are calculated as follows.

  • Standard hosts:  1,982 JPY × 2
  • Micro hosts: 600 JPY × 2
  • Metrics: 10 JPY × 80
    • 50 excess standard host B + 20 excess micro host B + 10 service metrics = 80

Case 2

Standard host C metrics 250 50 1 - 50
Micro host A metrics 20 0 - 1 0
Micro host B metrics 20 0 - 1 0
Micro host C metrics 20 0 - 1 0
Micro host D metrics 50 20 - 1 20
Service metrics 100 - - - 100
Labeled metrics 200 - - - 200
External URL monitors 50 30 2 - -

You are using 3 standard hosts, 4 micro hosts, 100 service metrics, 200 labeled metrics, and 50 external URL monitors. Standard host C has an excess of 50 metrics, and micro host D has an excess of 20 metrics. The charges are calculated as follows.

  • Standard hosts: 1,982 JPY × 5
    • Actual standard hosts × 3
    • (50 external URL monitors used - 20) ÷ 20 = 1.5, round up
  • Micro hosts: 600 JPY × 4
  • Metrics: 10 JPY × 370
    • 50 excess standard host C + 20 excess micro host D + 100 service metrics + 200 labeled metrics = 370

  • Standard hosts: 1,982 JPY × 2
    • (50 external URL monitors used - 20) ÷ 20 = 1.5, round up

Micro host A metrics 20 0 - 1 0

You are using 1 micro host. The charges are calculated as follows.

  • Micro host: 600 JPY × 1
  • Minimum usage fee deficiency: 1,382 JPY
    • Minimum usage fee 1,982 JPY - Micro host usage fee 600 JPY = 1,382 JPY
    • If you use billable Mackerel features such as posting metrics or external URL monitors, and your usage fees are less than the fee for 1 standard host, your charges will be rounded up to 1,982 JPY (tax excluded; 2,180 JPY tax included), the fee for 1 standard host.

External URL monitors 10 0 0 - -

You are using 10 external URL monitors only. The charges are calculated as follows.

  • Minimum usage fee deficiency: 1,982 JPY
    • Minimum usage fee 1,982 JPY - External URL monitors usage fee for up to 20 0 JPY = 1,982 JPY
    • The minimum usage fee includes up to 20 external URL monitors.
    • If you use billable Mackerel features such as posting metrics or external URL monitors, and your usage fees are less than the fee for 1 standard host, your charges will be rounded up to 1,982 JPY (tax excluded; 2,180 JPY tax included), the fee for 1 standard host.

Traces - - - - - 7.5M

You are using 2 micro host, 7.5M trace spans. The charges are calculated as follows.

  • Micro host: 600 JPY × 2
  • Trace spans: 300 JPY × 3M spans
    • Usage 7.5M spans - Free Tier 5M spans = 2.5M spans → 3M spans, round up

Case 10

Case 9 Metrics used /
Number of external URL monitors		 Excess metrics handled /

Traces - - - - - 7.5M

You are only using traces with 7.5M spans. The charges are calculated as follows.

  • Trace spans: 300 JPY × 3M spans = 900 JPY
    • Usage 7.5M spans - Free Tier 5M spans = 2.5M spans → 3M spans, round up
  • Minimum usage fee deficiency: 1,082 JPY
    • Minimum usage fee 1,982 JPY - Micro host usage fee 900 JPY = 1,082 JPY
    • If you use billable Mackerel features and your usage fees are less than the fee for 1 standard host, your charges will be rounded up to 1,982 JPY (tax excluded; 2,180 JPY tax included), the fee for 1 standard host.
